rukus.text: And indeed, (in the old days), Nuh (Noah) cried to Us, and We are the best of those to answer him
And We rescued him, and his family from the great destruction (of the Flood)
And made his children (and descendants) to live (and stay on this earth)
And We left for him (this noble blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
Peace! (and greetings) to Nuh (Noah) among the (Our) Creation
Truly, like this do We reward those who do good
Verily, he (Nuh) was one of Our believing servants
Then We drowned the others (in the Flood)
And surely, among those who followed his (Nuh’s) way was Ibrahim (Abraham)
When he came to his Lord with a pure heart
When he said to his father and to his people, "What is it that, which you worship
Is it a lie, false gods other than Allah, that you want
Then what do you know about the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)
Then he took a look at the stars
And he said, "I am truly sick (at my heart)
So they (his people) turned away from him, and left (him)
Then he turned to their gods and said: "Will you not eat (from what is offered to you)
What is the matter with you that you do not speak (and make sense)
Then he turned upon them (their gods), striking (them) with the right hand
Then (the worshippers) came with quick steps, and faced (him)
He said: "Do you worship what you have carved (yourselves)
While (it is) Allah (Who) has created you and (also) what you have made
They said: "Build for him a house (burning like a furnace), and throw him into the blazing fire
So (after having failed; See 21.69), they then took a way (to hurt) against him, but We made them the ones most ashamed
And he said: "Verily, I am going to my Lord! He will surely guide me
O my Lord! Grant me (a progeny) of the righteous
So, We gave him the good news of a boy ready (to be born) to suffer and be patient

And when (his son, Ismail) became (the age to) work with him, he (Ibrahim) said: "O my son! I see in a dream (vision) that I offer you in sacrifice (to Allah): Now see what is your (own) thought!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do like you are commanded: You will find me, if Allah so wills one who has (great) patience (and constancy)
Then, when they both had submitted their wills (to Allah’s Wish), and he (Ibrahim) had laid him (his son, Ismail) prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice)
We called out to him, "O Ibrahim (Abraham)
You have already fulfilled your vision!"— Verily, thus We do reward those who do good
Indeed, it was clearly a trial (for Ibrahim)—
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (with that of a ram)
And We left for him (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
Peace be upon to Ibrahim (Abraham)
Verily, thus do We reward those who do good
Indeed, he was one of Our believing servants
And We gave him the good news of Ishaq (Isaac)— A prophet— One of the righteous
We blessed him and Ishaq (Isaac): And of their children (and descendants) are (some) who do right, and (some) who clearly do wrong to their own souls
